reviews.review:
I just ~~*illegally*~~ watched the Emoji Movie.
I like to torture myself.
Honestly, it's not an original film in the slightest. If you want a "you can fit in and still be yourself" story, watch Wreck-It Ralph.
Only positive thing I can say is that the animation is well-done and it's bright and colorful (which is a plus for me).
Biggest problem, aside from the fact it's about emojis, is that it's extremely predictable and a 100% cash-in. They got sponsers from Candy Crush, Just Dance, Spotify, Twitter, Dropbox and YouTube (all were mentioned/used in some way in the movie).
They spent too long on dead memes. Not only is it a shitty meme, it now dates the movie even more than it already was doing.
Rating: 3/10
Pros: Bright and colorful, the plot's been done worse in other films
Cons: Dead memes, "Bye, Felicia", Eggplant is a not-used emoji, villian has no redeemable qualities, Patrick Stewart is Poop, hit-and-miss jokes that miss so hard it hurts, tried pandering too hard, sponserships, it's about emojis.
I wish I could give it 0 stars.  The worst piece of s**t I've ever seen.
Pretty good film. Had a good plot, the pacing was very good, there was a very satisfying ending and overall a great film that will be studied through the ages.
I wish I could rate this lower, but I can't. This movie is pathetically shallow, sad, and embarrassing. Please, do anything else for 2 hours, literally anything else...
Believe it or not this movie was very funny if you it with friends the only thing wrong with this movie is that the eggplant emoji is more often used then the movie states it is.
This is a fun little flick that is better than the 0 percent given by this website!  Ricky Miller

A great emoji adventure! This movie was so well put together with the different emoji and apps along with the storyline! It was great because you could relate to the social media apps etc so it made it thoroughly enjoyable! I would recommend this film to anyone who loves their phone or just loves an adventure film! Loved it!
Garbage. Easily a cash grab at people liking emojis.
